Twilio is a cloud communications platform as a service company with HQ in San Francisco. Twilio allows software developers to programmatically make and receive phone calls, send and receive text messages, and perform other communication functions using its web service APIs.

Who are we looking for?
üìç You are a Java enthusiast and professional. There is at least one framework in which you can be called an expert. If you are a professional in other languages and are interested in working on JVM stack, do not hesitate to sign up!
üìç You understand scalability challenges and the performance of server-side code. You can design and develop horizontally-scalable, resilient and performing-under-load systems. 
üìç You are proficient in cloud technologies and are hands-on in at least one cloud platform: GCP, AWS, or Azure. You are able to both design and develop cloud-based systems and operate them in an automated fashion.
üìç Databases. You have experience with multiple storage technologies and can reason about how to choose the suitable storage technology for a given purpose.
üìç You are passionate about quality and can engineer it at all stages of software development.
üìç You have strong communication skills and desire to make an impact and thrive in small, collaborative, energetic teams.

In this role you will work with a flurry of cloud technologies offered by AWS, as well as by our own platform. DynamoDB, Cassandra, SQL, ElasticSearch, Redis, Lambda, Load Balancers, Kinesis, SQS, Spark, Kafka - we use practically everything on the menu.

Why join us?
ü¶â As a software engineer in the Messaging BU you will design, develop, deploy and operate software solutions at scale, and to help Twilio deliver real-time, low latency capabilities for next-generation communications.
üöÄ You will primarily collaborate with other teams based in Tallinn and San Francisco and, of course, rest of the Twilio engineering globally.
